intro: Hymenasplenium neocaledonicum, commonly known as the New Caledonian shield fern, is a species native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant exhibits a creeping growth habit, with rhizomes that spread along the forest floor. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, adapted to the humid, shaded environments of its native habitat. Hymenasplenium neocaledonicum is often found in lowland and montane rainforests, where it thrives in nutrient-rich, moist soils.
